text: Disney Plus’ schedule of new TV and movie releases for December 16-22, 2024, includes Morphle and the Magic Pets, SuperKitties Season 2, Star Wars: Skeleton Crew’s fourth episode, and Marvel Animation’s What If…? Season 3. On December 16, Morphle and the Magic Pets drops on Disney Plus. The animated series chronicles the life of the kind-hearted and fun-loving Mila. She engages in numerous adventures with her magical pet Morphle. However, every adventure comes with a new set of troubles. Further, SuperKitties Season 2 will be available on the streaming platform from December 18. It revolves around the friendship and unity between a group of kittens. These kitties are adorable but can also take up fearless avatars as super kitties to save people from trouble. Also coming out on the platform this week is Star Wars: Skeleton Crew’s fourth episode. The recent episode of the series set the stakes high with Jod’s identity linked with Crimson Jack from the comics. Further, it will be interesting how the kids deal with new adventures to safely return home. Additionally, Marvel Animation’s What If…? Season 3 releases on Disney Plus. The animated series will feature everyone’s favorite Marvel icons caught up in interesting situations. However, the twist is they are now in an alternate universe. New Disney Plus releases for December 16-22 2024 Below are all the new TV shows and movies being added to Disney Plus from December 16-22, 2024. December 16 Morphle and the Magic Pets (S1, 6 episodes) December 17 Blink The Simpsons Christmas Double Episode Exclusive to Disney+ “O C’mon All Ye Faithful” December 18 ZOMBIES: The Re-Animated Series (S1, 4 episodes) SuperKitties (S2, 5 episodes) Star Wars: Skeleton Crew – Episode 4 December 20 Lost Treasures of the Bible (S1, 6 episodes) December 22 Marvel Animation’s What If…? (Season 3) – Premiere For more Disney Plus content, check out the easter eggs in Star Wars: Skeleton Crew Episode 3. Also, find out if you can watch Mickey Mouse Funhouse online for free.
html:
Disney Plus’ schedule of new TV and movie releases for December 16-22, 2024, includes Morphle and the Magic Pets, SuperKitties Season 2, Star Wars: Skeleton Crew’s fourth episode, and Marvel Animation’s What If…? Season 3.

On December 16, Morphle and the Magic Pets drops on Disney Plus. The animated series chronicles the life of the kind-hearted and fun-loving Mila. She engages in numerous adventures with her magical pet Morphle. However, every adventure comes with a new set of troubles.

Further, SuperKitties Season 2 will be available on the streaming platform from December 18. It revolves around the friendship and unity between a group of kittens. These kitties are adorable but can also take up fearless avatars as super kitties to save people from trouble.

Also coming out on the platform this week is Star Wars: Skeleton Crew’s fourth episode. The recent episode of the series set the stakes high with Jod’s identity linked with Crimson Jack from the comics. Further, it will be interesting how the kids deal with new adventures to safely return home.

Additionally, Marvel Animation’s What If…? Season 3 releases on Disney Plus. The animated series will feature everyone’s favorite Marvel icons caught up in interesting situations. However, the twist is they are now in an alternate universe.

New Disney Plus releases for December 16-22 2024

Below are all the new TV shows and movies being added to Disney Plus from December 16-22, 2024.

December 16

  • Morphle and the Magic Pets (S1, 6 episodes)

December 17

  • Blink
  • The Simpsons Christmas Double Episode Exclusive to Disney+ “O C’mon All Ye Faithful”

December 18

  • ZOMBIES: The Re-Animated Series (S1, 4 episodes)
  • SuperKitties (S2, 5 episodes)
  • Star Wars: Skeleton Crew – Episode 4

December 20

  • Lost Treasures of the Bible (S1, 6 episodes)

December 22

  • Marvel Animation’s What If…? (Season 3) – Premiere

For more Disney Plus content, check out the easter eggs in Star Wars: Skeleton Crew Episode 3. Also, find out if you can watch Mickey Mouse Funhouse online for free.
